intro: Praealstonia cernua, commonly known as the hanging lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that hang from the stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Praealstonia cernua is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
